byline.contributor: Emily Feng reported from Beijing and Alexandra Stevenson reported from New York.
byline.original: By EMILY FENG and ALEXANDRA STEVENSON

abstract: Broad array of smartphone apps and online services are helping Chinese middle-class to invest in foreign projects, including real estate development in hot property markets like New York and San Francisco, by helping them cross legal and language barriers globally; trend is part of exodus of wealth outside China, as investors seek to diversify over fears of slowing economy.

headline.print_headline: Middle-Class Chinese Join Exodus of Wealth
headline.main: Small Investors Join China’s Tycoons in Sending Money Abroad

snippet: Middle-class Chinese are using new technology to move their wealth out of the country and into American investments, from San Francisco to New York....
lead_paragraph: Middle-class Chinese are using new technology to move their wealth out of the country and into American investments, from San Francisco to New York.
